projects.title: Coralsseum
projects.long-description: Created in 16 hours of development time with a team of 2 programmers and 2 artists. I was responsible for getting the crabs gameplay setup. I created a way for adding in up to 8 players within the arena. This was created for Global Game Jam 2025

projects.title: Undisputed
projects.long-description: First Major Game release, joined the project as their first programmer in 2020 and helped build out the team for this project. Initially launched into early access in January 2023, with 1.0 launch completing in October 2024. Worked alongside all teams to help get features implemented into the game and also worked particularly close with the design team, to ensure their vision was implemented correctly.

projects.title: Duckpot
projects.description: Ponder the orb, feed its greed
projects.long-description:
This game was created for the GMTK Game Jam 2022. Our final scores were as follows:
  • Presentation - Top 1.9%
  • Creativity - Top 3.7%
  • Overall - Top 4.8%
    • . I was responsible for setting up the dice rolling mechanics, while doing so I created a power-up system around the resulting dice number when thrown at the orb

projects.title: RETry
projects.long-description: Game Submission for the GameDev.tv Game Jam. Made over 10 days. I was responsible for programming everything but the UI in this project.

projects.title: Looking for Dove
projects.description: Build a nest to attract birds
projects.long-description: Our team consisted of 2 Artists and 2 Coders. I scripted the introduction, character movement and throwing, as well as the end scenario.

projects.title: Bready... Set... Duck
projects.long-description: Our team consisted of 2 coders and 1 artist. I worked on the vehicle physics and controls. And helped with setting up the duck feet. We ranked 285th out of 5,418 entries for Originality

projects.title: Procedurally Generated Rooms
projects.description: An example of procedurally generated rooms
projects.long-description: This is for an un-named project that never got fully developed. The idea is to have different shaped rooms and generate a map that has no overlap. Took about 1 month to get in a good place

projects.title: Extraction
projects.long-description: Created in 48 hours. I was the only coder. We wanted to produce a cute horror game taking in some memories from our past. We created a game where you have a power source and need to recharge at plug sockets. The player needs to find the keys to escape via the window.

projects.title: Text Playground
projects.description: Throw text around this sandbox area
projects.long-description: Little idea I was playing around with where you can throw the text you name, at things.

projects.title: P L A G U E T I M E S
projects.description: Survival crafting game created for LD45
projects.long-description: This is for an un-named project currently in development. The idea is to have different shaped rooms and generate a map that has no overlap. Took about 1 month to get in a good place

projects.title: Merchants Quest
projects.description: Retro-style JRPG where the shopkeepers lie to you.
projects.long-description: Created in 4 days for Community Game Jam. Team consisted of 3 programmers, 1 artist and 1 sound engineer. I was responsible for scripting the Inventory and Shop systems. I also helped create the shader for the screen transitions.

projects.title: Swing Boi
projects.description: Swing using your grapple hook to complete the levels
projects.long-description: This project was created entirely by me in 4 days for Weekly Game Jam 110. I had been wanting to make a game with a grapple hook mechanic, so used this time to make a puzzle platformer version.

projects.title: Pie, anyone?
projects.long-description: The game was created as part of a 4 day game jam at my University. Our team consisted of 2 coders and 2 artists. I was responsible for Player Controller, Getting switch controllers to work nicely with Unity, Gameloop mechanics, and Getting 8 players working via 2 screens. This game ended up winning the Student vote for Best Game

projects.title: VR Puzzle Tools
projects.long-description: This was created as part of my Final Major project during my 3rd year of University. This tool was used to create puzzles in the game These Lands. During this project, I learnt a lot about editor scripting and have used the knowledge in future projects

projects.title: These Lands
projects.long-description: This game was created in conjunction with VR Puzzle Tools. I was responsible for all programming and Unity implementation. This game is a VR Adventure Puzzle game built in Unity. It has had over 1,500 downloads on itch after being put into a Black Lives Matter Bundle. On Steam, the game has sold over 100 units. The final mark I received for this game was 95/100

projects.title: Bongo Beat Down
projects.description: Take a trip to bongo town
projects.long-description: Created for Global Game Jam 2019. I was responsible for getting the Input working correctly in Unity, creating a Bongo bashing mini-game, helping rig the characters in Unity, and setting up the Game Flow. Our team consisted of 2 coders, 1 artist, 1 designer and 1 sound engineer. Used N64 Donkey Kongas as controllers.

projects.title: Draumskrok
projects.long-description: First person rogue like game, controlled by your voice. Use commands such as move, reload, shoot and stop to make your way through the level. This game can be played entirely with your microphone, or can be played with a combination of the WASD keys and your microphone. Created in 4 days for the Solent Winter Game Jam. The theme was dreams. I was the sole programming on this project. I utilized a speech api to convert speech to interactions in game

projects.title: DirectX 11 Tech Demo
projects.long-description: This was created for a DirectX 11 assignment at University. We were tasked with creating a playable demo around the DirectX 11 API.

projects.title: Monkey Mayhem
projects.long-description: 1v1 game where you play as ragdoll monkeys swinging from branch to branch, trying to pick up as many bananas as possible. I was responsible for Swinging Mechanics, Banana Pickups, End screen cutscene, and all of the Art except for a couple of pieces of UI

projects.title: Canine Climber
projects.description: Enter the arena and climb to the top
projects.long-description: This game was created in 4 days for the Solent MegaJam, going from the theme; "Mans best friend". The idea is to reach the top of the statue within your turn. Once you have done so, you can then make the tower bigger by changing the pose of your dog to make it harder for the other player

projects.title: Procedural Patterns 2D
projects.long-description: Created a project that uses the Unity Tilemap system to procedural generate maps. Was made public on the Unity Technologies GitHub. Algorithms included: Perlin Noise, Random Walk, Cellular Automata, Directional Tunnel.

projects.title: The Adventures of Zach the Monkey with a Pig on his back
projects.description: Game where a kid was our designer
projects.long-description: Unity Kids Game Development Project. Created during Playing Field event at Unity offices. Game designed by a kid named Sam, developed by a team of 8 people. The game features a Monkey and Pig duo helping a spaceman find pieces of his rocket. I was responsible for the art of all the characters, as well as the player controller and camera movements. The programming was done in C# and the game was created in Unity.

projects.title: Brain Shaper
projects.description: Transmit your ideas and shape the future minds.
projects.long-description: Created at Global Game Jam 2018 in Hamar with theme 'Transmission'. Created in 48 hours, focusing on gameplay mechanics and screen transitions.

projects.title: Game Rover
projects.long-description: This game was created in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 39. The base idea was to create a platformer where you use energy to get around. Used Unity's Tilemap system and sprite mask system. Art was created by James Redler, while I handled all the programming.

projects.title: Qong for PS4
projects.long-description: Created for a University module in 2nd year, receiving a first for the project. A Pong-based game with additional features including Trail Renderer, Particle Effects, Simple AI, Controller Vibration, and Dynamic Controller LED Color based on ball position. Built using C++ with PlayStation 4 API, extending provided renderer and shader systems.

projects.title: In Transit
projects.long-description: Created in 5 days for the Solent Games Jam. Won multiple awards: Best Game (Student Vote), Best Art (Tutor Vote), and Best Audio (Tutor Vote). Later had updated art by James Redler including a 6ft roller banner. Showcased at the 2017 Southampton Game Festival.

projects.title: Fusion Storm
projects.long-description: Created for Gameplay and Game Design module at Southampton Solent University, receiving a first. A shoot-em-up where size affects gameplay - larger size means more damage but slower movement, smaller size means less damage but faster movement. Features include a wave system for enemy spawning and local leaderboard. All assets were created by me, keeping the art style minimal.

projects.title: Lagerloaf
projects.long-description: Local multiplayer game created in 4 days by a team of 4. A multiplayer version of Doodle Jump with powerups. Won Best Programming and Most Fun awards. I was responsible for the player controllers.

projects.title: CataCrunch
projects.long-description: Originally planned as a 1v1 snake game with AI, adapted to local 1v1 due to time constraints. Art by James Redler. Learning points included improving pathing system grid alignment and object spawn collision detection.

projects.title: Bearholt
projects.long-description: Resource management simulator created for Global Game Jam 2016, taking an abstract approach to the theme. First Global Game Jam experience, with significant learning about Unity UI systems.
